Description: Body sherd of Fikellura pottery amphora; exterior, white slip: black tongue pattern at base of neck; below, two friezes of vertical dashes framing key maender band; undetermined part of body frieze at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 49' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80, NAU49), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Miletus.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-80, 82, 84, fig. 3) (NAU 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.055)
